name: ggez
body:
# ggez

A Rust library to create Good Games Easily.

More specifically, ggez is a lightweight game framework for making 2D games.  It aims to
implement an API quite similar to (a Rustified version of) the Love2D game engine.  This means it will contain
portable basic functionality, without including things that force your game to function a particular way.

It's not meant to be everything to everyone, but rather a good base upon which to build higher-level systems and a useful tool that lets you immediately get started on projects such as game jams.  As such, it provides:

* Filesystem abstraction that lets you load resources from folders or zip files
* Hardware-accelerated rendering of images
* Playing and loading sounds
* Text rendering with TTF and bitmap fonts
* Interface for handling keyboard and mouse events easily through callbacks
* Config file for defining engine and game settings
* Easy timing and FPS measurement functions.

## Getting it

ggez is built on the latest stable Rust compiler and distributed on <crates.io>.  To include it in your project, just
add the dependency line to your `Cargo.toml` file:

```
ggez = "0.2.0"
```

Or, check out the [github page!](https://github.com/ggez/ggez)

## Examples

The best place to find example code is in the project `examples` directory.  There is a simple hello-world example, and a more complete asteroids-like game.

## License

## Contact

Open an issue in the Github project, or join us in `#rust-gamedev` on `irc.mozilla.org`.
